page.title: 20THE VIEW FROM FARLOW SCHOOL.
page.content: { { {June 1985.} Our Hawthorn hedges are powdered white On the green chequered hillside Which lies banked before our classroom window In the cool, bright,summer light. {*****} Woodland on Brown Clee Hill mixes with grass. Red/brown ploughed fields dot the green. This land slopes into the valley below And swallows whirl above the sheep. {***** Brown Clee lies like a horse on its side. Its full rounded haunches rise. The long tail is a tree lined horizon. Our hill is loved, large still. {*****}
